title: NEBNext Ultra II FS DNA Library Prep Kit Protocol: Part 2/3 - PCR Enrichment of Adaptor-ligated DNA
author: Opentrons
description:
Links:
 Part 1: Fragmentation/End Prep and Adapter Ligation
 Part 2: PCR Enrichment of Adaptor-ligated DNA
* Part 3: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
With this protocol, your robot can perform the NEBNext Ultra II FS DNA Library Prep Kit protocol for use with inputs ≥ 100 ng, described by the Instructional Manual.
This is part 2 of the protocol, which includes (2.3) PCR Enrichment of Adaptor-ligated DNA.

You will need:
 P10 Single-channel Pipette
 P50 Multi-channel Pipette
 Opentrons Magnetic Module
 Bio-rad Hardshell Full-skirted 96-well PCR Plates
 PCR 8-Tube 0.2 mL Strips
 10 uL Tips
process:
Input the number of columns your samples occupy in the sample plate (8 samples in a column).
Select your tip racks.
Download your protocol.
Upload your protocol into the OT App.
Set up your deck according to the deck map, and see Additional Notes for reagent setup.
Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support article.
Hit "Run".
notes:
PCR Strips:
 i5 Primers (8): column 1
 i7 Primers (1~12): starting at A2

If you have any questions about this protocol, please contact protocols@opentrons.com.

markdown.title: NEBNext Ultra II FS DNA Library Prep Kit Protocol: Part 2/3 - PCR Enrichment of Adaptor-ligated DNA
markdown.author: [Opentrons](http://www.opentrons.com/)
markdown.description:
Links:
* [Part 1: Fragmentation/End Prep and Adapter Ligation](./1503-dr-travis-glenn-lab-uga-ehs-part1)
* [Part 2: PCR Enrichment of Adaptor-ligated DNA](./1503-dr-travis-glenn-lab-uga-ehs-part2)
* [Part 3: Cleanup of PCR Reaction](./1503-dr-travis-glenn-lab-uga-ehs-part3)

With this protocol, your robot can perform the NEBNext Ultra II FS DNA Library Prep Kit protocol for use with inputs ≥ 100 ng, described by the [Instructional Manual](https://www.neb.com/protocols/2017/10/25/protocol-for-use-with-inputs-greater-100-ng-e7805-e6177).

This is part 2 of the protocol, which includes (2.3) PCR Enrichment of Adaptor-ligated DNA.

---

You will need:
* P10 Single-channel Pipette
* P50 Multi-channel Pipette
* [Opentrons Magnetic Module](https://shop.opentrons.com/products/magdeck)
* Bio-rad Hardshell Full-skirted 96-well PCR Plates
* PCR 8-Tube 0.2 mL Strips
* 10 uL Tips
markdown.process:
1. Input the number of columns your samples occupy in the sample plate (8 samples in a column).
2. Select your tip racks.
3. Download your protocol.
4. Upload your protocol into the [OT App](https://opentrons.com/ot-app).
5. Set up your deck according to the deck map, and see Additional Notes for reagent setup.
6. Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our [support article](https://support.opentrons.com/ot-2/getting-started-software-setup/deck-calibration).
7. Hit "Run".
markdown.notes:
PCR Strips:
* i5 Primers (8): column 1
* i7 Primers (1~12): starting at A2

---

If you have any questions about this protocol, please contact protocols@opentrons.com.
